Printer-friendly Version
 

Welcome to the Town of Harpswell's Official Website

If you need assistance finding what you are looking for, follow this email link for information.

Like us on Facebook to get all the latest information and news! 

What's New:
-MSAD 75 School Budget Information and Schedule
-Tax Season is quickly approaching - get some help at no cost!  See flyer. Be sure to ask about the property tax fairness credit and then apply for the Town's.

Important Dates:
1.  April 18 - Tax Office will be closed for training.
2.  April 27, 2019 - Household Hazardous Waste Date.  See flyer for more information.
3.   April 27, 2019 - 10am to 2pm - Medication Collection Day at the Town Office.  Bring those unused human or pet medications to the Town Office for proper disposal.
4.  April 30, 2019 6:00pm - Browntail Moth presentation by Dr. Groden.  See flyer.
5.  May 7, 2019 6:00pm - Aquaculture Forum at Harpswell Community School.  See flyer

Employment Opportunities
The Town of Harpswell is seeking candidates for several positions - see the job descriptions for each below and complete an employment application.
1.  Part-time firefighter
2.  Recreation Programs Assistant
3.  Cedar Beach Monitor
4.  Deputy Harbormaster/Marine Technician

Requests for Proposals
1.  Mooring Software - see RFP.  Due 4/19/19  See addendum #1
2.  Pott's Point floats/ramp - see RFP.  Due 4/19/19

Adobe Acrobat Reader- If you do not have Adobe Acrobat Reader on your computer you will need this application to read .PDF files.  This is a free download.

Printer-friendly Version
 

Welcome to Elizabeth City

 
Elizabeth City is a wonderful community that has been named one of the “100 Best Small Towns in America” and is ranked by Money Magazine as "one of best places to live on the East Coast."  Situated in the northeastern corner of North Carolina on the Pasquotank River and Intracoastal Waterway, the City lies just west of the Outer Banks of North Carolina and just south of Hampton Roads, Virginia. It is rich in history yet progressive and growing.
 
The City is very proud to have been declared a "Coast Guard City" on May 29, 2015 by Admiral Paul Zukunft, 25th Commandant of the United States Coast Guard.  This long-awaited honor was celebrated by the minting of a commemorative medallion, which is depicted at the top of this page.


We invite you to visit soon and find out why we are known as "The Harbor of Hospitality!"

What's Happening!

Elizabeth City Area Events Provided by Convention and Visitors Bureau
First Friday ArtWalk in our beautiful downtown! 5:30 to 8 p.m.
Downtown Waterfront Market Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. June through August
